20110107184847.000|20110107184848.000|CC1|MAYBE THE PRESIDENT'S AND SOME  
20110107184848.000|20110107184849.000|CC1|OTHER PEOPLE ADVISING HIM.      
20110107184849.000|20110107184851.000|CC1|THE FUTURE OF THE ECONOMY WILL  
20110107184851.000|20110107184853.000|CC1|DEPEND ON BRINGING THE DEFICIT  
20110107184853.000|20110107184856.000|CC1|DOWN, MAYBE GRADUALLY, MAYBE SO 
20110107184856.000|20110107184858.000|CC1|THAT THERE CAN BE A RESTORATION 
20110107184858.000|20110107184859.000|CC1|OF PRODUCTIVITY.                
20110107184859.000|20110107184901.000|CC1|>> BUT THERE'S SOME THINGS THAT 
20110107184901.000|20110107184903.000|CC1|AREN'T TRUE IN THAT STATEMENT.  
20110107184903.000|20110107184904.000|CC1|NO ONE SAYS THAT THE SOCIAL     
20110107184904.000|20110107184906.000|CC1|SECURITY IS PART OF THE DEFICIT 
20110107184906.000|20110107184907.000|CC1|PROBLEM.                        
20110107184907.000|20110107184909.000|CC1|YET, PART OF THE PRESCRIPTION   
20110107184909.000|20110107184909.000|CC1|WAS THAT.                       
20110107184909.000|20110107184912.000|CC1|WE DO HAVE A DEFICIT PROBLEM IN 
20110107184912.000|20110107184912.000|CC1|THE LONG TERM.                  
20110107184912.000|20110107184915.000|CC1|WE DON'T HAVE ONE IN THE SHORT  
20110107184915.000|20110107184915.000|CC1|TERM.                           
20110107184915.000|20110107184917.000|CC1|LOOK, YOU WANT TO CURE THE
